{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3611299,"name":"Jeanne Boyarsky","username":"Jeanne_Boyarsky","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jeanne_boyarsky/{size}/65129_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-04T01:53:05.440Z","cooked":"

(Mods: I’m not sure if this is ok to post so no worries if you delete it)

I’ve written a number of Java certification books and published a new book called “Real World Java” earlier this year. (FRC team 694 and FTC teams 310/479 are in the acknowledgments).

The reason I’m posting here is because the target audience is people who have learned the syntax of the language but aren’t ready for the materials professionals use because they assume a lot of context. Aka a bridge to your first job/internship. So if you are looking for summer reading…

Link to book on Amazon for preview feature and publisher page for table of contents
